title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was relatively simple; general questions about how the instiute is the best fit for you and how you can contribute to the community. Specific questions about your topic of interest were asked on a separate interview with potential advisors
Interview Questions: Why is Stevens a good fit for you

title: Instructional Designer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Jersey City, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: During the hiring process, there are three interview rounds. The initial round serves as a screening, during which you have the opportunity to ask any relevant questions. The second round consists of three administrators, each asking five questions. Lastly, the final round involves an interview with the lead ID.
Interview Questions: What is your ID process?

title: Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Ask some basic java questions and then coding. Then I think it's important that their queries focus on the expression of your thoughts. Because it proves your communication skills as well as showing your thinking skills.
Interview Questions: What is microservices？ Advantages and disadvantages of microservices architecture?

title: Career Center Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: I had 3 virtual, back-to-back interviews with 3 people (separately, on the same day).  They clearly didn't coordinate questions because they were asking me the same things.  On top of that, they were outrageously rude.  It felt more like an interrogation.  I had spent time researching the Career Center and the Institute online.  I was mocked that I was sharing the data that I read about and I was asked what else I knew besides the information on the website.  I honestly did not know what to say to that nasty comment since I thought part of the interview was for them to tell me more about it since I have never worked there.  Additionally, one of the interviewers was picking apart my work experience and educational experience from 10 years ago.  It was completely ridiculous and irrelevant (such a long time ago).  She was asking me when I worked part time and when I went to school part time, when I transitioned to full time, etc.  There have been times with I worked 2 part-time jobs to survive, while going to school, things in my life changed (I am a human, so sue me).  This privileged person probably had the luxury of being dependent on others financially and could simply not understand why anyone would leave a job or pursue their education.  She also made a comment about how it was strange that I took a new job during COVID-19 which was bizarre to me.  Wouldn't it be a strong point that I helped a company get through the pandemic?  She was blatantly judging me for very strange things.  It was very unpleasant and I wish I would have ended the interview in the middle.
Interview Questions: Are percentages all you know about us?

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Basic Questions about tidiness and organization, asked how about availability and academic schedule. Makes sure  that you will be on time and attentive even when the boss is not in the room.
Interview Questions: What is your availability and class schedule?

title: Assistant Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Long interview process with multiple rounds. A lot of people are involved in interviews and will get varying questions. It can be an entire day process. Interviews with different departments, management, and even students.
Interview Questions: What is your perspective of student development?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: It was a very easy interview. Basic questions asked regarding personal traits and Communication skills and curriculum. Good interviewer. Overall good experience. Just be confident and be prepared to talk on your resume.
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: In linear classification algorithms, instances are viewed as vectors in multi-dimensional space. Since the range of values of raw data varies widely, some objective functions do not work properly without normalization. For example, if one of the features has a broad range of values, the distances between points is governed by this particular feature
Interview Questions: Data project and machine learning

title: Postdoctoral Fellow Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Describe what I studied and what I will do and when I will able to start to work. And asked me if I have an experience on lab set up.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Email, and a brief interview, nothing technical, only behavioral. Honestly will give jobs to anyone who needs it. Email, and a brief interview, nothing technical, only behavioral. Honestly will give jobs to anyone who needs it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward  easy to follow and they are upfront. Nothing hidden and open communication during the process . Would recommend to future employees, flexible and room to continue growing your career
Interview Questions: Basic

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not too complicated. It was based on the behavioral questions. Also, described that the role was aligned with my area of interest.  The interview process is quite simple and easy. So no need to worry about it. Be confident and make sure you answer correctly.
Interview Questions: Describe about yourself and how are you fit for this role ?

title: Residential Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Nov 2019
Interview Descriptions: it was seamless. more about what you bring to the table and why you want to work with the division. it was more informal and friendly. easy to be comfortable with interviewee
Interview Questions:
tell me about yourself
why this position
have you had any previous experience with this position.

title: Talent Acquisition Specialist Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: It was a 2 part process.  There was an initial 20-30 min phone screen that was conducted by the director.  I was later invited for an in person interview a few days later where I met with the director and the VP of the department.  The interview interview lasted about a hour or so, and felt more like a conversation of my skills and prior experiences.
Interview Questions: tell me why your looking for a job change?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: You can apply through Workday or you can approach all departments specially dining, mail services. They directly  hire without applying online through workday. All departments will say apply through workday some times reference works.
Interview Questions: Introduce yourself, What are you studying here, dont you think its a career change for you?

title: Associate Director, Digital Marketing Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: First was a phone interview with the hiring manager, then an in-person interview with various team members. The in-person interview took place over 3 hours, meeting with several groups throughout this session.
Interview Questions: What is your experience with digital communication?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions:
Invited to the interview by confirming day and time. 
Went to the Office and was asked to wait patiently.
Called in to the office and conducted interview. Was taken to the tour of office and recruiter was very humble
Interview Questions: Tell me something about yourself

title: Rpa Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: telephonic interview followed by two rounds of technical and HR interview. In which they will give you scenario based coding test and then a behavioral round with oral technical questions.
Interview Questions: The process you worked with Automation?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Apply through workday external of SIT and wait for the interview call. If you get the interview call then talk to student employees already working about the work environment and how things work.
Interview Questions: Do you have any experience related to hospitality

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, GA) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Describe about yourself. Tell them when did you graduate and what all projects have you done and tell them more about the projects which are related to that field. And when are you graduating and when did you complete your undergraduate degree.
Interview Questions: What projects have you done in Web technology and which languages did you use ?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Only apply for the position via online, then I was interviewed by some faculty, after two weeks, I got my part time job. This interview is not too hard. And I got the result of interview only 2 weeks.
Interview Questions: Describe yourself briefly

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: I learnt with my current professor during my master program. Later on, I had a good performance in her class and I did her project in last semester of my master. Then, I got the PhD offer for her.
Interview Questions: Why you want to be a PhD student?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: I researched the position online and talked to some professors about it. I applied online by submitting my resume and then was called in for a in person interview on campus with the professor in charge of the research.
Interview Questions: Asked technical questions with respect to the research and safety questions. Also asked a lot of best fit personality questions such as how you over came a struggle

title: Alumni Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions: Recent graduates may apply by speaking with the office of alumni affairs - an interview can then be scheduled.  The interview takes around an hour.  They are looking primarily for people who can serve well in a marketing and "client" relations role, prior experience (of any kind, including informal/unpaid/for a student group) is considered pretty good proof of your ability to do that.
Interview Questions: How would you keep a hostile prospect who you have just cold-called on the line?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Apr 2018
Interview Descriptions: It's easy to take that with professor and other students in the lab. Just introduce yourself and show them the related projects you did, and answer some basic technical questions.
Interview Questions: Talk about yourself and your project.

title: Data Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Feb 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Behavioural interview 
Excel Test followed by a designing test and final interview with the manager
The basic excel was taken by the students working in the office
Good experience and faster process
Interview Questions: Vlookup, Pivot, Concatenate, and other functions

title: Full Time Position Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Applied for the job several months prior forgot I had applied. Get a phone call, set up an interview for a week later. The interviewer was late for our arranged phone interview. Had an hour phone interview, asked questions that were not pertaining to my resume. The questions were regarding duties I had no experience in, nor did the job description advertise those would be duties I'd be handling. I was completely thrown in the interview, although having experience and knowledge of my area. When it was my turn to ask questions the interviewer was not paying attention, or said they were not applicable to Stevens.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at Stevens/Department?

title: Senior Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ)
Interview Descriptions:
Pretty basic stuff. Phone call followed by an in person with the hiring manager and then a second on site for a panel interview.  

The most shocking thing about the second interview was that one of the people sitting in on the interview actually had the audacity to take a phone call IN THE ROOM.  Didn't even have the courtesy to excuse himself and take it outside.

In hind sight, I should have walked out and not looked back.
Pretty much a prime example of the kind of respect given.
Interview Questions: All normal questions. Nothing specific other than what I do, where I've been, and why I think I'd be good for the role.

title: Software Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: I applied through Steven's career Workday site. I called for in-person Interview. It was nice.I applied through Steven's career Workday site. I called for in-person Interview. It was nice.I applied through Steven's career Workday site. I called for in-person Interview. It was nice.
Interview Questions: Describe your Past experience?

title: Executive Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions:
Had a successful phone interview, followed by a grueling 2.5 hr interview with several departments and directors.  Was excited that I was asked to  come back for a final interview.   They wanted someone detail oriented so I pointed out some typos on their website.  

I received a canned email several days later that they made an offer to an internal applicant.
Interview Questions: How would your colleagues describe you?

title: Student Life Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Oct 2017
Interview Descriptions: The Director of Student Life and I chatted about my interests and how I am involved on campus.  We discussed ideas about the goal for the programming activities, what type of events were currently scheduled and ideas about events that we can run for the students in the future.
Interview Questions: How are you involved on campus?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (New York, NY) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview was good and smooth. Not much difficult. But you have to hit the crisp point to land the job. Interviewers are quite particular about your work ethic. Also, you gotta know what u want.
Interview Questions: Given a particular situation how would you react?

title: PhD Graduate Student Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Jun 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was relatively simple; I sent emails to the heads of the different labs that I was interested in working at and waited for them to respond either positively or negatively. I met with the lab heads, toured their facilities and equipment, and spoke with the other PhD candidates to get their opinions. The lab I choose seemed like the best opportunity for me and I accepted the offer.
Interview Questions: Which group would be your first choice to work in within the lab?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: Apply on line first, then submit the application document with you past education history. Come to the office of the professor. Talked about 1 hour to ask for some personal interesting of future research.
Interview Questions: What do you want to be in the next 5 years?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Interview was a friendly one, No technical questions asked. Sometime all the official members can conduct an interview. Friendly conversation, no stress or hectic questions. sometimes just one round or max two of them.
Interview Questions:
About graduating year, timings of class and gpa and about your course ?
What change can one bring in the existing system of work?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: It was a thirty mins long interview and the managers/recruiters taking the interview were very polite. They sent out the results very quickly and I loved the overall experience. The work culture seemed to be employee friendly.
Interview Questions: What is team playing according to you?

title: PhD Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Jersey City, NJ) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions:
Taking with Professors one by one. Then You can find a Professor you like. Taking more about your background and interesting. Professors are so kind. Do not worry.

You need to submit a writing sample if you want to apply.
Interview Questions: Area you are interested.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Jan 2017
Interview Descriptions: The process was pretty straight forward, I had to apply online and in person, both. Once selected I got called for an interview, based on my answers and skill set, I was assigned a position.
Interview Questions: Do I understand MATLAB

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was easy, quick and simple. I had two interviews spaced over three days, and the questions I was asked and skills I had to demonstrate were relevant and easy to perform.
Interview Questions: Only questions relevant to my job

title: User Support Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was situation based and was conducted in very friendly manner and also helped me learn about new concepts in networking , Hardware and servers. The interview was conducted by 3 high level mangers of the department who were friendly through the process and imbibe knowledge in me.
Interview Questions: What is VDE?

title: Communications Marketing Writer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ)
Interview Descriptions: The VP of Communications & Marketing talked the whole time and then it ended. Never asked about skills or experience or process or anything related to performing the work. He vented about his own frustrations. Got the offer.
Interview Questions: Are you married and do you have kids?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Jun 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The professor asked me to introduce myself and to give a brief talk about my motivation to apply for this part time job.
Then, he reviewed my CV line by line, project by project in detail, especially for the algorithm and computer software part.
Finally, some chat about my school life and coursework.
Interview Questions:
Do you have related work experience?
What kind of software do you use?

title: IT Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Jersey City, NJ) in May 2016
Interview Descriptions: # interviews starting with Basic HR and leading it technical troubleshooting. Overall a though process, no tricks just making sure you knew your stuff. Would recommend going in with at least a techincal foundation to understand converstations, but prior expeerience is not a must
Interview Questions: How to remove and protect against viruses

title: Student IT Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Apr 2016
Interview Descriptions: It was easy going. I was called for the interview and showed around. Mostly HR type interviews. Nothing really to worry about. Anyone could get in. Plus luck is quite important
Interview Questions: Do you have knowledge about IT ?

title: Teaching Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Mar 2016
Interview Descriptions: Got an email for an on-campus interview (no telephone call). Interviewed by a few teaching faculty and taught a sophomore class.  I was also interviewed by the program chair and Deans. Overall not very complicated and the university paid for travel and accommodation. However it was a long hot day from 8:30am till 5:00pm. And then I had to wait for more than 1 month to hear back.
Interview Questions: What courses can you teach?

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Meet with one professor and give you some academic questions. The best way is you took some course which this professor taught before. And it need to fill lots of paperwork.
Interview Questions: Some academic questions.

title: Graduate Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: Very Easy, just general behavioral questions. The recruiter was very pleasant and even seemed to be rooting for me.At the end he said the recruiter will get back to you.
Interview Questions: Do you have prior work experience

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: There is no interview. You can apply for the position, but whether you can get the job depends on the dean decision. After hiring, you will take a training program, which is usually helpful to shape the teaching style. You performance will be graded by the students, which can also determine whether you can keep the position or not.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Graduate Assistant, Stevens Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is pretty straight forward, you have to apply online, if they like your resume,  you get a call. Sometimes they do take people who go and visit them personally. And many a times employee referral might work for similar kind of job openings.
Interview Questions: they mostly asked about the projects I was involved in during my bachelors, and how would they help them in the position they were looking for. I happened to have a web programming experience and they were looking for the same. So it went ok

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, was contacted by email a month or two later to arrange an interview. I interviewed in person a couple weeks later. The interview was pretty standard; met with some professors, discussed both my research and the research involved in the position. Toured the department.
Interview Questions: Describe your research.

title: Manager Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: It is a short interview, just 10 minutes. Two interviewer with one interviewee. They want to hire a people who have patients and could communicate with students. And they just want you know how to use excel and other Microsoft software.
Interview Questions: Tell us the skills you know about excel?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in May 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied online through the internal Stevens Portal and received an interview. Asked for brief go through of my resume and past work experiences. Behavioral questions about how to handle large number of students and tough situations with manager. Large emphasis on attention to detail. Asked for any follow up questions
Interview Questions: How would you handle situations where there are many students waiting to speak with you regarding immigration issues

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions:
About your background, courses, and score. Easy, some normal conversation, the most important thing is your good transcript.
Apply on school's website, then the secretary will contact you. Previous related experience is better
Interview Questions:
About your background, courses, and score. Easy, some normal conversation, the most important thing is your good transcript.
Apply on school's website, then the secretary will contact you.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: I applied to the Student Support Center, and got the interview maybe within a week, two rounds of interview in total, the first around was with two GAs, and the second round was with the Director and coordinator.
Interview Questions: I was interviewed by another two GAs during the first round, just routine questions, but the one they asked was interesting, they asked me to describe something interesting about myself

title: TA Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: Just talk with my professor how I matched with that position. Before you are the student and you must get A in that course. Actually it is determined by the professor himself, not the hiring committee. So I think it is easy for you to find position there.
Interview Questions: What is your favorite programming language, why?

title: Graduate Admissions Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Oct 2014
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and received a call from the office to come in for an interview. Went on the first interview then was asked to come in for a second. After the 2nd interview, I was under the impression that everything went well. I waited for a response. After not hearing from them, I sent several follow up emails over the course of two months to find out the status of my application or if a decision was made. Never heard from them again.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work in higher education

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with the professor in charge of the research study and then with the professor in charge of the lab. It was very casual and relaxed. They were both very nice and were just trying to get to know me and my interests in the field.
Interview Questions: What do you know about environmental engineering?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I filled out the online application through the employment portal of the college and was called for the first round of interview within a week. The first round was behavioral and turned out to be a very good and long conversation. The same afternoon, I was called for the second round of interview with the Dean of the college. She also took a behavioral round and then asked me about the skills required for the job, the main being the Microsoft excel. The interview lasted for about 25minutes. The same evening, I got the mail confirming that I got hired :)
Interview Questions: Q. I was asked to briefly describe myself?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: I applied the job in April and got a phone call to interview in late May then I was already out of the states. I came back in August and applied again, and got hired at late Sept.. Can't say short.
Interview Questions: Questions are easy, bosses asked about excel, how to handle emergent request from students etc.

title: Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology
Interview Descriptions: just an interview by other CAs.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Director Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: The committee interviewing me consisted of three people who were not well-qualified: they understood very little about the role I was interviewing for or the place of such of role in American universities today.  For me it was very easy as a result.  I also brought valuable good experience.
Interview Questions: No scenario questions.

title: Federal Work Study Student Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: They talked to me and got to know me better and they made me take a test. The interviewer was very nice and gave me a lot of attention. The interview was in public and was not behind closed doors. I felt that the interview was pretty fair and they listened and heard me out.
Interview Questions: How much experience do you have filing?

title: Professor, Adjunct Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Easy.  Interview process was very brief and impersonal but relevant to my experience and professional background. No pretense of trying to engage in something more complicated than actually getting to the real nuts and bolts.  h
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administration Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and was contacted to set up a phone interview about 2 weeks later.  The phone interview was a 1-on-1 with the hiring manager.  I was then called in for a 1-on-1 on-site interview with the same person.  The interview lasted about 90 minutes.  They said they would call me within 2 weeks, which they did not.  I never heard from Stevens again.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position?

title: Web Administrator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was called for a phone interview and then followed up for an in-person interview with the department manager to discuss the position. The process was smooth and when I arrived I was greeted with a friendly smile and sat in the office awaiting for the Manager to arrive.
Interview Questions: How do you handle multiple projects at once?

title: Sales Person Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Jan 2012
Interview Descriptions: The process started with a phone screen from HR and then with one skype interview for 45 min before giving a flyout to Boston. The skype interview was mostly from my resume and my experience in handling huge datasets (using SQL) nothing technical as such. The role also needs good presentation skills along with simple data visualization for presenting to client
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Network Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Mar 2010
Interview Descriptions: it's nomal, nothing exciting
Interview Questions: see urself in five years

title: Web Developer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Stevens Institute of Technology (Hoboken, NJ) in Nov 2009
Interview Descriptions: Just checked my basic skills and my experienced.
Interview Questions: Whats your experience in learning new Technology ??
